meanings.definition: A container typically made of wood or cardboard, used for storing or transporting items.
meanings.sent1: I carried my books in the boxes.
meanings.sent2: The delivery man placed the package in the boxes.
meanings.sent3: The cat jumped into the empty boxes and played hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like boxes stacked neatly in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The boxes in the attic held treasures from the past.

meanings.definition: A square or rectangular area on a page or screen for entering information or displaying content.
meanings.sent1: Please type your name in the boxes provided.
meanings.sent2: The website layout had multiple boxes for different sections.
meanings.sent3: The boxes on the form seemed to dance as I filled them out.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a series of interconnected boxes, each holding a different thought.
meanings.sent5: The TV screen was divided into colorful boxes showing different channels.

meanings.definition: To put into a box or enclosed space.
meanings.sent1: She boxes up her old toys for donation.
meanings.sent2: He boxes the fragile items carefully before moving.
meanings.sent3: The magician boxes up the rabbit and makes it disappear.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were boxed away, hidden from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The chef boxes the leftovers for the customer to take home.

meanings.definition: To participate in a boxing match.
meanings.sent1: He boxes at the gym to stay fit.
meanings.sent2: She boxes with her trainer to improve her skills.
meanings.sent3: The robots were programmed to box in the ring for entertainment.
meanings.sent4: Life sometimes feels like we are boxing against unseen opponents.
meanings.sent5: The two friends decided to box for fun in the backyard.
